page.title: 04HISTORIC HOUSES.
page.content:
Althorp House,much extended since its building in the fifteen hundreds by Sir John Spencer,has about seventy-five rooms.About ten full time staff are engaged in the running of it.The gardens were redesigned circa 1860.
It is a family home.The Earl and Countess Spencer are in residence most of the time.
The house was opened to the public in the 1960s and contains one of the finest art collections in Europe. Following the marriage of Lady Diana Spencer to H.R.H.Prince of Wales the popularity of Althorp has increased. Open all year the peak months are July and August.About 35,000 people visit annually.There are also various evening functions.
